page.title: 06Our Milkman
page.content: Clifford's Dairies{(Marlow)}was built in approximately 1890. They took over Hughes Dairies at the bottom of Dean Street. They serve about 500 customers a day and they sell about 14 912 pints a week. They have 17 milk floats, and employ 26 people. They get the milk from farms in Buckinghamshire and Berkshire, but it is bottled in Bracknell. There are 20 branches of Clifford's Dairies in this area. A milk float can only carry 930 pints of milk because of the law.The milk floats that they use travel along at about 15 to 20 miles an hour. To keep the milk from going sour in the summer they have curtains on the vans and they put the milk into cool boxes.They also sell other dairy products as well as fruit juice, bread, potatoes, chickens, tea, coffee and sausages.
